page.title: 08HOUSING DEVELOPMENT,DRAYTON
page.content: {The Drayton area}has seen a rapid housing expansion along the Fakenham road out of{Norwich}in recent years, the villages of{Hellesdon,Drayton}and {Taverham}now forming a near continuous ribbon development.Former fields and forestry plantations have given way to houses,with the allied growth of shops and other amenities,although there are still enough fields for the area to appear rural in places.Most of the housing has taken the form of{estates of detached or semi-detached family homes,mainly for those working in Norwich.Suprisingly,the area has a{bus {service}that is at best skeletal,the majority of people using cars as their sole form of transport,which can lead to serious road congestion at peak times.There has been a slight increase in{local industry,}notably the successful Carter building firm.
